data.title: Classic diner
data.text: Had a late breakfast there whilst waiting for service on my auto. Food, service, atmosphere were all good. Nothing was bad or unexpected, but nothing was really great either. Still... I would return.

data.title: Hidden gem of a diner
data.text: I love this place. I've never had a bad breakfast here. Here's a short list of things that are good: waffles, French toast, breakfast sandwiches, omelets, and home fries. Parking is a challenge but worth it.

data.title: Best breakfast in town
data.text: Great place if you're looking for a cozy, hometown diner. Friendly staff and consistently tasty fare. Limited parking, so get there early.

data.title: Great Brunch any day of the week
data.text: This is a little gem.   Breakfast lunch menu is huge.  Love the corned beef hash. The hash browns are perfect.  A little crispy, but not dried out. A lot of regular customers.  Very homey.

data.title: A Good Place for Breakfast
data.text: This is a good neighborhood diner.  The breakfast food is decent and the service is good.  Whenever my parents come into town we eat here - they know that it will be a welcoming atmosphere.  Of course, the parking (to the rear of the building) is always a challenge, but that is part of the charm.

data.title: I love this place!
data.text: I have been going here since 1985, maybe longer.  I love it here.  The staff is good and food better.  It is the best diner type food I have ever had, I love me some greasy diner food.  LOL  If you are looking for good cooking this is the place.

data.title: Very Traditional Diner Like Atmosphere
data.text:
We've visited the Village Green numerours times over the years and a couple of times this winter.  Stay with the standards and you'll be happy.
Yummy breakfasts (especially like corned beef hash and cheese omelet).  Great burgers and sandwiches.  Fries and onion rings are also really good.
The food is a great value - much cheeper than the chains.

data.title: Great Greasy Spoon!
data.text: I love this place and have been going since I was a kid so part of the love might be sentimental. It's a small diner in a weird spot of 355. Parking is not great and it's easy to miss if you don't know where to look. The waitresses have been working there for years. The service is consistent and I love the food. The home fries with onions are delicious and the omlettes are great. Don't expect a gourmet meal but if you like diner food on a lazy Sunday this place is perfect!

data.title: Good local place
data.text:
Full disclosure:  I have been going to this place regularly for the past 2 or 3 years, averaging once or twice a week, & am considered "a regular" who gets his drink order on the table even before I sit down & generally only need to say the first ingredient before they know pretty much what I want.  As an indication of the value of the place, I'd estimate that 60-70% of the customers are regulars to some degree or other, and the waitresses can greet at least 15-25% of the breakfast customers by name.

This is basically a breakfast and lunch place - they close at 3 pm.  They're open every day of the year except for Christmas Day & one other holiday (I forget which one).  They have a really good weekday breakfast special and the menu is dominated by breakfast choices.  They also make very good, and large, subs, and they have a small choice of Greek dishes along with some typical American choices.  I recommend the Gyros and the steak & cheese subs in particular, along with the above-mentioned breakfast special.

The staff has been there forever and is a little "quirky" (at least with the regulars).  None of that "Hi, my name is Branson/Jon/Hilare with an "e"/whatever, and I'll be your server today" type greeting - more like "Sit wherever you want and I'll get to you as soon as I can" type of place.  If you like to be doted on, you won't enjoy your fine dining experience here, but if you like a typical small town atmosphere amidst the affluence of the DC suburbs, you'll like the Village Green.

data.title: Local Diner!
data.text: I stopped into this little place to have breakfast while waiting to check into a local hotel. The food was good and the staff were very friendly.  The place is nothing fancy but the overall experience was very pleasant. I will return as I visit the area often.

data.title: Nothing fancy, good food, fast service
data.text: We were looking for a great breakfast place that wasn't a chain. We found one here in Gaithersburg. Nothing fancy, lots of specials, friendly wait staff. The standard breakfast special 2 eggs, toast, potatoes, breakfast meat, was very good, just what you would expect. Their Eggs Benedict was very good. They use a non traditional hollandaise sauce. Had a hint of mustard in it versus the more standard lemony flavor. It was different, but very good. French toast and the corned beef hash were also good. The one thing missing from this place is the waitstaff coming around offering refills on your coffee. We will come back again.

data.title: Quaint corner dinner
data.text: Stopped in for early brunch after Black Friday, the food was good. The hot chocolate was great and the corn beef hash was tasty. This is a good value for the price.  My children loved the waffles and the bacon. The diner seems like a nice family owned business, but it could use some updating (maybe some new flooring, chairs and tables).
